src:
Cabor Panahan Optimis Tatap Sea Games 2019
02 Nov 2019, 17:33 by Indra Virgiantara


Cabor Panahan Optimis Tatap Sea Games 2019

KBRN, Jakarta : Tim panahan Indonesia menjadi salah satu cabang olahraga yang di harapkan meraih medali emas pada ajang multi event Sea Games 2019 mendatang di Filipina, PP Perpani menargetkan tim panahan Indonesia mamapu mendulang empat medal emas dalam Sea Games 2019.Target tersebut telah dimatangkan dengan sejumlah rangkaian ujicoba termasuk ke Korea Selatan. Ketua PP Perpani Kelik Wirawan Widodo menyatakan bahwa persiapan cabor panahan dapat berjalan lancar dengan dukungan berbagai pihak, ungkapnya kepada RRI, Sabtu (02/11/2019).Dan ia merasa puas bahwa pelatnas jelang Sea Games tersebut berjalan dengan baik demi raihan prestasi panahan nanti di ajang multi event terbesar negara – negara ASEAN."Persiapan cabang olahraga panahan sudah baik, pelatnas sudah berjalan dengan baik juga, untuk itu tetap semangat bagi para atlet dan pengurus cabor panahan," ungkapnyaPersiapan atlet pelatnas panahan Indonesia sudah dimulai sejak bulan Maret 2019 dan dipusatkan di Jakarta, latihan di lapangan Panahan Senayan juga merupakan salah satu upaya agar para atlet terbiasa bertanding di lapangan kelas Internasional.
Pelatnas panahan Indonesia diisi oleh 16 orang talet putra dan putrid yang berasal dari bebrbagai daerah di Indonesia, mereka akan bertanding di kelas recurve dan compound pada Sea Games nanti.
text:
Cuba closes with four medals in the U23 World Cup
02 Nov 2019, 17:33 by ACN

With a harvest of two gold medals and an equal amount of bronze, with four competitors, Cuba closed today its participation in the World Championship wrestling of the sub 23 years category.

The first Cuban to climb the awards podium was the freestyle gladiator Reineri Andreu, who conquered the 57-kilo gold medal at the World Cup, which will conclude tomorrow in Budapest, Hungary.Andreu, owner of a golden metal and seventh place in events of that type, in the 2017 and 2018 editions, respectively, he defeated Adlan Askarov, from Kazakhstan, 10-0 due to technical superiority. With four victories, the talented athlete of the island said goodbye , who got his second title at that level, and then the libertarian Yonger Bastida (92 kg), a silver medalist in the universal youth competition in Tallinn, Estonia, last August, would secure the bronze in his weight by defeating 6-2 Demur Megeneishvili, from Georgia. Among the women, Milaymis de la Caridad Marín was responsible for providing more joy to the Caribbean nation with the conquest of the scepter in the 72 kilos. Marín, champion in the Tallinn and mo narrates in the Youth Olympic Games of Buenos Aires 2018, he took over the gold by beating China Xiaoqian Wang 6-2.In that final match the fighter of the island started below 0-2 on the scoreboard, but knew how to overcome to prevail with three passes back, two of them in the last seconds. The Cuban harvest was completed on Saturday by the exponent of the Greco-Roman modality Daniel Gregorich, with his bronze in the 87 kg. Gregorich, silver in the second edition of that sub tournament 23 last year, he had a tough fight with the Russian Vaag Margarian, in a lawsuit that ended up matched to five points, but when he scored in the last action he won.
